articles.author: Prabhat Ranjan Mishra
articles.title: Oldest human ancestor: 7 million-year-old fossil proves bipedal signs, challenges history - Interesting Engineering
articles.description: Using 3D technology and other methods, the team identified Sahelanthropus’s femoral tubercle, which is the point of attachment for the largest and most powerful ligament in the human body.
articles.content: A group of anthropologists’ new analysis offers powerful evidence that Sahelanthropus tchadensisa species discovered in the early 2000swas indeed bipedal by uncovering a feature found only in bipedal… [+3586 chars]
